meanings.definition: A person who poses riddles or puzzles.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed the challenge presented by the riddlers at the party.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends gathered around the campfire to listen to the riddlers' latest brain teasers.
meanings.sent3: The riddlers at the fair had everyone scratching their heads with their tricky questions.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a room full of riddlers, each one waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The old book was filled with the secrets of ancient riddlers, waiting to be uncovered.

meanings.definition: Plural form of riddler, referring to multiple individuals who pose riddles or puzzles.
meanings.sent1: The riddlers in the competition challenged each other with their clever wordplay.
meanings.sent2: In the library, the shelves were lined with books written by famous riddlers.
meanings.sent3: The town was known for its population of riddlers, always ready to stump you with a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The forest echoed with the laughter of the mischievous riddlers, hidden among the trees.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed artifacts once owned by legendary riddlers, each with its own story to tell.
